BAT01CT001:

TEXT: WINDING TEMPERATURE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Main transformer winding temperature supervision, stage1, has activated
ACTION: Check that all six cooling fans of main transformer are in operation. Check coolers for cleanliness
BAT01CT003:
KKS: BAT01CT003

STATUS: > HIGH

STATUS: FAULT

STATUS: FAULT
REASON: One or more of the six cooling fans are not in operation
ACTION: Check that all MCB's for cooling fans are in service position. Check over-current relays. If necessary, investigate reason for relay actuating and reset
BFA00EA804:

KKS: BFA00EA805

KKS: BFA00GS101
TEXT: 0.4kV INCOMING FEEDER
STATUS: OVOLT
REASON: Over-voltage on BFA infeed
ACTION: Check incoming voltage and grid voltage, adjust voltage by changing generator output voltage and / or tap position of main transformer

KKS: BFA00GS101

STATUS: UVOLT
REASON: Under-voltage on BFA infeed
ACTION: Check incoming voltage and grid voltage, adjust voltage by changing generator output voltage and / or tap position of main transformer

ACTION: Check 24 Vdc auxiliary voltage at terminals of re-closing device XT374 A-E in panel BFA04. If no auxiliary voltage is available, check 24 Vdc MCB's Q23 and Q24 in BJA01B panel

KKS: BFA00GS501
TEXT: 0.4kV UNIT BOARD BFA04
STATUS: UVOLT
REASON: Under-voltage in BFA panel
ACTION: Check incoming voltage and grid voltage, adjust voltage by changing generator output voltage and / or tap position of main transformer

KKS: BFA00GS501

STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Control voltage for re-closing device is low

ACTION: Contact ABB
BFT01CL001:

TEXT: TRANSF OIL LEVEL
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Oil level in aux. transformer is low
ACTION: Check for oil leaks. Check indication on expansion tank. Refill with insulating oil(refer to manufacturers instructinos)
BFT01CT001:
KKS: BFT01CT001
TEXT: OIL TEMPERATURE
STATUS: > HIGH

REASON: 
ACTION:
BPA00EA100:
KKS: BPA00EA100
TEXT: PROTECTION CRITERIA
STATUS: ACTIVAT
REASON: Emergency off-order for starting device due to: FG starting equipment ON and Lube oil (or) pressure< 60% for more than 3 sec (or) Fire protection activated (or) Bearing metal temperature > max trip (or) Starting equipment failure (or) Generator transformer protection activated (or) Excitation equipment disturbed
ACTION: Check local indication panel at starting device for trip indications. Investigate reason and rectify fault. Refer to C&I diagrams to find out which signal has caused the trip of the starting system (C&I diagrams, section: FG starting equipment BPA) Investigate reason and rectify fault
BPA00EA801:
KKS: BPA00EA801
TEXT: STARTING EQUIPMENT
STATUS: DIST
REASON: Disturbance of starting device with low voltage power supply (BFA, 380Vac) not in under-voltage condition at the same time for more than 10seconds
ACTION: Check all breakers for the starting device are in the correct operating position ( refer to picture xxx/xxx on POS station) Clear reason for breaker mis-operation and restart. Check rotor barring system is in correct position(i.e. the piston of the rotor barring device must be in its lower end positition) as soon as starting isolator BAA20GS100 is switched ON
BPA00EA802:
KKS: BPA00EA802
TEXT: START MAIN BREAKER
STATUS: DIST
REASON: Earth fault on 2.15 kV system (or) Fault of starting main breaker BBA00GS201 (or) Fault of control voltage
ACTION: If earth fault is detected, check insulation of 2.15kV system and locate faulty/dirty parts. If the disturbance lamp of the starting main breaker BBA00GS201 is illuminated, check for both control voltages, tripped MCB's in control cabinet, breaker not in test position or local/remote selector switch not in remote position
BPA00EA803:
KKS: BPA00EA803
TEXT: START MAIN BREAKER
STATUS: LCINT
REASON: Operating selection switch of starting main breaker is set to 'local' position
ACTION: Set operating selection switch of starting main breaker back to remote positoin
BPA00EA804:
KKS: BPA00EA804
TEXT: START SELEC BOARD
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Fault on selection isolators BCA00GS***
ACTION: Check MCB's for control and operating voltages
BPA01EG801:
KKS: BPA01EG801
TEXT: STARTING EQUIPMENT
STATUS: WARN
REASON: Collective alarm indication from starting device
ACTION: Check on the local indication panel of the starting device which alarm has been actuated and investigate reason.(Refer to starting device manual for details)
BPA01EG802:
KKS: BPA01EG802
TEXT: STARTING EQUIPMENT
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Trip of starting device
ACTION: Check on the local indication panel of the starting device which alarm has been actuated and investigate reason.
BTL00EG801:
KKS: BTL00EG801
TEXT: 220V BATT CHARGER
STATUS: FAILR

ACTION: Trouble shoot battery charger in accordance with operating instructions for battery charger
BTM00EG801:

BTN00EG801:

STATUS: OVOLT
REASON: Over-voltage at 220 Vdc panel BUA (relay K37 at BUA01B is energized)

STATUS: UVOLT

KKS: BUA00GS501
TEXT: 220VDC UNIT BD EARTH
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Earth fault in 220 Vdc distribution system
ACTION: Localize defective insulation or equipment. Reset with push-button on earth fault device
BUA00GS803:
KKS: BUA00GS803
TEXT: 220VDC BD CONTR V
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: BUA panel control voltage (24 Vdc) failure (relay K30 in panel BUA01B is de-energized)

BUB00GS501:
KKS: BUB00GS501

STATUS: OVOLT

KKS: BUB00GS501
TEXT: 24VDC UNIT BD A
STATUS: UVOLT
REASON: Under-voltage of 24 Vdc A system
ACTION: Check MCB in panel BUB01B. Investigate reason for tripping and reset with push-button at BUB01B. Check 24Vdc A battery voltage. If battery voltage is too low, check battery charger
BUB00GS801:
KKS: BUB00GS801
TEXT: 24VDC UNIT BD A CV
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: BUB panel control voltage (220 Vdc) failure (relay K30 in panel BUB01B is de-energized)

BUC00GS501:
KKS: BUC00GS501
TEXT: 24V DC UNIT BD B
STATUS: OVOLT
REASON: Over-voltage of 24 Vdc B system
ACTION: Check 24 Vdc B battery voltage. If battery voltage is too high, check battery charger. Reset alarm with push-button at BUC01B

KKS: BUC00GS501
TEXT: 24V DC uNIT BD B
STATUS: UVOLT
REASON: Under-voltage of 24 Vdc B system
ACTION: Check MCB in panel BUC01B. Investigate reason for tripping and reset with push-button at BUC01B. Check 24Vdc A battery voltage. If battery voltage is too low, check battery charger
BUC00GS801:
KKS: BUC00GS801
TEXT: 24V DC UNIT BD B CV
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: BUC panel control voltage (220 Vdc) failure (relay K30 in panel BUC01B is de-energized)

KKS: CBA02GW001

STATUS: FAILR

STATUS: DIST
REASON: Disturbance in panel CBA03 Common annuciation

CBP01GW001:
KKS: CBP01GW001

STATUS: DIST

CEA01EA881:
KKS: CEA01EA881
TEXT: 220V/24V CHARGER
STATUS: DIST
REASON: 220 V battery charger failure (or) 24 V unit battery charger A failure (or) 24 V unitbattery charger B failure

CEA01EG801:
KKS: CEA01EG801
TEXT: GEN CB AIR SUPPLE
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Common alarm, generator circuit breaker: Compressor for generator circuit breaker fault (or) Generator circuit breaker run time exceeded (or) SF6 isolating gas pressure wrong
ACTION: Check air supply for correct pressure. Check SF6 isolating gas for correct pressure. If pressure is too low, contact ABB or refill it. Check indications at local indication panel. I there are any disturbance messages
CEA01EG802:
KKS: CEA01EG802
TEXT: GENERATOR SWITCHGEAR
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Auxiliary voltage for starting isolator earth switch fault (or) Failure on the 380 Vsupply to generator CB (or) Failure on the air cooling fans of the generator CB compartment (or) Temperature too high (or) Discrepancy of ON/OFF orders
ACTION: Check incoming auxiliary voltages in accordance with generator switch-gear module. If one of the MCB has tripped, investigate reason, rectify fault and reset. Check air conditioning unit in generator switch-gear and its temperature setting. Check for discrepancy on breakers (at POS)
CEA01EG803:
KKS: CEA01EG803
TEXT: OIL LEVEL TRANSFORMER BAT01
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Oil level within main transformer, BAT01, is low
ACTION: Check for leakages. Check local level indicator. Refill with insulating oil according to manufacturers instructions
CEA01EG806:
KKS: CEA01EG806
TEXT: 415V UNIT BD
STATUS: DIST SW
REASON: 380 Vac infeed breaker BFA00GS101 or coupling breaker BFA00GS401 is disturbed
ACTION: Check breakers and locate fault (over-current)

KKS: CEA01EG807
TEXT: 0.4kV UNIT BD BFA02/03
STATUS: LCINT
REASON: 380 Vac infeed breaker BFA00GS101 or coupling breaker BFA00GS401 is in test or local position

CEA01EG808:
KKS: CEA01EG808
TEXT: 0.4kV UNIT BD AUX VOL
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: Failure in one of the supervision voltage supplies for the BFA panels(220 Vac/dc)
ACTION: Check if MCB Q10 in panel +BFA04F01 has tripped, investigate reason for MCB actuating and reset. Check 220Vdc supervision voltage in panel +BFA04
CEA01EG809:
KKS: CEA01EG809

STATUS: DIST
REASON: One of the 48Vdc solenoid valve supply MCB's, in panel BJA02, has tripped
ACTION: Locale tripped MCB in panel BJA02, investigate reason for MCB tripping and reset rectifying the fault
CEA01EG810:
KKS: CEA01EG810
TEXT: AUX CONTROL
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: One of the MCB's in panel BJA01 or panel BJA02 has tripped
ACTION: Locale tripped MCB in panel BJA01 or BJA02, investigate reason for MCB tripping and reset after rectifying the fault
CEA01EG811:
KKS: CEA01EG811
TEXT: 24V DC AUX FEED IN
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: 24 Vdc auxiliary voltage I or II BJA panel is missing
ACTION: Check if main breaker Q30 for auxiliary voltage I and Q33 for auxiliary voltage II in panel BJA01E are switched on. Check fuses F30, 31 and F33, 34 in panel BJA01E. If one of the fuses has blown, investigate reason replace fuse. Check 24Vac infeed from panel BUB01 and BUC01
CEA01EG812:
KKS: CEA01EG812
TEXT: AUX CONTROL AUX VOLT
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: 220Vdc auxiliary voltage for BJA panel is missing
ACTION: Check if main breaker Q30 for 220Vdc auxiliary voltage in panel BJA01K is switched on. Check fuses F30, 31 in panel BJA01K. If one of the fuses has blown, investigate reason and replace fuse. Check MCB's Q4 and Q9. If one of the MCB's has tripped, investigate reason for MCB actuating and reset
CEA01EG813:
KKS: CEA01EG813
TEXT: 220V DC UNIT BOARD
STATUS: DIST SW
REASON: Summary alarm for distrurbance of emergency cooling oil pump, jacking oil pumps or hp power oil emergency pump
ACTION: Check thermal over-current protections in the MCB's. Investigate reason and reset

STATUS: DIST

CJP00EA100:
KKS: CJP00EA100
TEXT: FG GT AUTO PROGRAM
STATUS: SMZ
REASON: One or more permissives are not satisfied within the tolerance time
ACTION: Check which step-up criteria is missing (can be seen on POS) and rectify problem

KKS: CJP00EA100
TEXT: FUEL GAS PRESSURE
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Gas pressure before gas control valve is greater than 27.6 bar with gas trip valve, MBP31AA003, not closed and the generator breaker open.
ACTION: Contact ARCO. Do not attempt re-start until supply pressure has been normalized
CJQ00EA801:
KKS: CJQ00EA801
TEXT: COLD AIR TEMP GEN
STATUS: WRONG
REASON: Generator cooling air temperature is either higher than 70deg C or less than 15deg C
ACTION: Check that both generator cooling fans are running. Check cleanliness of generator cooling water coolers. Ensure all water isolating valves at generator cooler inlet and outlet are open. If unit is at standstill ensure standstill heaters are in service
CJQ00EA802:
KKS: CJQ00EA802
TEXT: WARM AIR TEMP GEN
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Either one or both of the temperature measuring probes MKA13CT012 / 022 indicate a temperature higher than 115deg C for more than 65 seconds
ACTION: Check that both generator cooling fans are running. Check cleanliness of generator cooling water coolers. Check that all water isolating valves at generator cooler inlet and outlet are open. Reduce reactive power back to zero
CJQ00EA803:
KKS: CJQ00EA803
TEXT: CW PRESS BEF PUMP
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Pressure in generator cooling water system, before circulation pumps, is less than 0.6 bar for more than 3 seconds
ACTION: Check for water leaks. Refill system with de-min. water if required (for pressure, refer to final settings)
CJQ00EA804:
KKS: CJQ00EA804
TEXT: CW PRESS AFT GEN
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Pressure in generator cooling water system, after generator, is less than 1.3 bar for more than 3 seconds. This will cause the cooling water pump to trip after 8 seconds.
ACTION: Check for water leaks. Refill system with de-min. water if required (for pressure, refer to final settings)
CJQ00EA805:
KKS: CJQ00EA805
TEXT: WARM AIR TEMP GEN
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Both of the temperature probes MKA13CT013 / 023 indicate a temperature higher than 125deg C
ACTION: Check that both generator cooling fans are running. Check all cleanliness of generator cooling water coolers. Check that all water isolating valves at generator cooler inlet and outlet are open
CJQ00EA806:
KKS: CJQ00EA806
TEXT: BLEED VALVES
STATUS: N. CLOSED
REASON: One or more of the bleed valves are not closed with the unit at nominal operational speed
ACTION: Check air supply pressures for bleed valves on gauges MBX69CP001-CP003. Readjust if necessary (refer to final settings for values). Check air supply lines to bleed valves for leaks. Check air filters MBC69AT002 and AT003 for cleanliness. If the bleed valves are actually closed ( can be heard by an exprienced operator at the bleed valve silencer), check limit switches of faulty bleed valve during next shut down
CTA00EG801:
KKS: CTA00EG801
TEXT: VOLT TRANSF MCB
STATUS: TRIP
REASON: One or more MCB's of a voltage transformer (PT) in generator breaker module tripped
ACTION: Check MCB's Q221, Q222, Q223, Q224, Q225, Q231, Q232, Q233, Q234. Investigate reason for MCB tripping and reset
CXQ10EG801:
KKS: CXQ10EG801
TEXT: GT ENCLOSURE FANS
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: One or more of the fanpower supply MCB's has tripped
ACTION: Locale tripped MCB in ventilation and lighting panel, locale inside generator enclosure. Ascertain cause of trip and reset after rectifying fault
CYE10EG001:
KKS: CYE10EG001
TEXT: FIRE ALARM
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: One of the fire emergency channel's has been actuated
ACTION: Investigate reason for the emergency tri actuation. Reset fire emergency trip pushbutton with release key. Reset fire protection trip
CYE10EG801:
KKS: CYE10EG801
TEXT: FIRE DETEC SYSTEM
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Common disturbance message from the fire fighting cubicle
ACTION: Determine the reason for the defect, by checking the fire fighting panel, and eliminate the disturbance
CYE10EG901:
KKS: CYE10EG901
TEXT: FIRE ALARM GT MODULE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Fire detection line for GT module activated
ACTION: Check locally at GT Module for fire. Reset alarm at the fire control panel if there is no fire, check reason for false alarm
CYE10EG916:
KKS: CYE10EG916
TEXT: FIRE ALARM ENCLOSURE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Fire detection linefor enclosure activated
ACTION: Check locally at GT enclosure for fire. Reset alarm at the fire control panel if there is no fire, check reason for false alarm
CYE10EG917:
KKS: CYE10EG917
TEXT: FIRE ALARM HENRY MODULE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Fire detection line for Henry Module activated
ACTION: Check locally at GT Henry Module for fire. Reset alarm at the fire control panel if there is no fire, check reason for false alarm
EGC00EB100:
KKS: EGC00EB100
TEXT: FUEL FORWARD SYSTEM
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Collective alarm from the fuel forwarding system
ACTION: Check at the local control panel for the forwarding system wether: Local/remote switch is in position Local. Supply supervision (under-voltage) has activated. One or more pump motor over-current protections has activated. Ground fault detection has activated
EGD30CP001:
KKS: EGD30CP001
TEXT: DP FUEL FORW FILTER
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Differential pressure across fuel oil forwarding filter is too high
ACTION: Change over to stand-by fuel oil filter and clean the dirty filter
HYY00EY901:
KKS: HYY00EY901
TEXT: BOILER PROTECTION CH1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Trip signal from the boiler protection. Causes unload protection of gas turbine until divertor is closed. If unit trips: divertor failed to close within 120seconds.
ACTION: Consult steam plant operatives. Investigate reason why divertor failed to close within allowed time
MBA30CP025:
KKS: MBA30CP025
TEXT: EXH GAS PRESS
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Pressure in exhaust duct is higher than 50 mbar
ACTION: Check position of exhaust diveror flaps. Check position of boiler stack weather damper. Check that condensate trap is not full of water
MBA30CP026:
KKS: MBA30CP026
TEXT: EXH GAS PRESS CH1 MAX
STATUS: TRIP
REASON: Pressure in exhaust duct is higher than 60 mbar(channel 1 activated)
ACTION: Check position of exhaust diveror flaps. Check position of boiler stack weather damper. Check that condensate trap is not full of water
MBA30CP026R:
KKS: MBA30CP026R
TEXT: EXH GAS PRESS CH2 MAX
STATUS: TRIP
REASON: Pressure in exhaust duct is higher than 60 mbar(channel 2 activated)
ACTION: Check position of exhaust diveror flaps. Check position of boiler stack weather damper. Check that condensate trap is not full of water
MBA30CS001:
KKS: MBA30CS001
TEXT: OVERSPEED CHA > 110%
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Over-speed trip 110% activated(electrical)
ACTION: Determine reason for over-speed
MBA30CS002:
KKS: MBA30CS002
TEXT: OVERSPEED CHB > 110%
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Over-speed trip 110% activated(electrical)
ACTION: Determine reason for over-speed
MBA30CS003:
KKS: MBA30CS003
TEXT: OVERSPEED CHC > 110%
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Over-speed trip 110% activated(electrical)
ACTION: Determine reason for over-speed
MBA31AA002:
KKS: MBA31AA002
TEXT: F LIQ DRAIN VLV POS
STATUS: N. CLOSED
REASON: 3-way valve is in 'wash' or indeterminate position. Limit switch disturbed
ACTION: Return valve to 'operation' position. Check holder of limit switch. Check function / adjustment of limit switch
MBA80CP901:
KKS: MBA80CP901
TEXT: PRESS AFT COMPRESSOR
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Channel difference between channels 1 and 2 of compressor delivery pressure is higher than 3%
ACTION: Measure compressor delivery pressures. Check calibration of transmitters MBA80CP011 and MBA30CP012
MBA80CT005:
KKS: MBA80CT005
TEXT: SEAL-AIR TEMPERATURE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Seal air rotor front face, compressor side, is higher than 375deg C
ACTION: Deload unit, at least until alarm clears. Contact ABB
MBA82DA800:
KKS: MBA82DA800
TEXT: GUIDE-BLADE RELEASE
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Pressure for linear amplifier is insufficient at less than 60 bar
ACTION: Check pressure at solenoid valve. Check solenoid valve opens. Check for leakages

KKS: MBA82DA800
TEXT: GUIDE-BLADE POSITION
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Deviation between set-point for VIGV and actual position measurement is too high
ACTION: Adjust the set-point back to the actual position and reset. Attempt local / manual opeartion of VIGV to determine zone of fault. (only experienced personnel are to perform this task)
MBA82CG902:
KKS: MBA82CG902
TEXT: GUIDE-BLADE MEAS CH DIFF
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Deviation between the angle measurement from two transmitters is too high
ACTION: Check angle transmitters and recalibrate if necessary
MBA83EA801:
KKS: MBA83EA801
TEXT: CLEANING
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Essential criterias for cleaning are not fulfilled
ACTION: Check all blow-off valves are closed. Check FG fuel liquid supply and FG fuel gas supply are switched off. Check FG combustion chamber is switched off. Check VIGV is 'open'. Check that exhaust gas tract is 'open'
MBD10CY001:
KKS: MBD10CY001
TEXT: BEARING VIBR TURB VERT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at turbine bearing, in vertical plane, are higher than 8mm/s
ACTION: Verify reading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBD10CY002:
KKS: MBD10CY002
TEXT: BEARING VIBR TURB HORIZ
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at turbine bearing, in horizontal plane, are higher than 8mm/s
ACTION: Verify reading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBD20CY001:
KKS: MBD20CY001
TEXT: BEARING VIBR COMPR VERT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at compressor bearing, in vertical plane, are higher than 8mm/s
ACTION: Verify reading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBD20CY002:
KKS: MBD20CY002
TEXT: BERAING VIBR COMPR HORIZ
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at compressor bearing, in horizontal plane, are higher than 8mm/s
ACTION: Verify reading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBH00EA803:
KKS: MBH00EA803
TEXT: COOL AIR VALVES POS
STATUS: WRONG
REASON: Valves on top of combustion chamber are not in corect position after 10 seconds from flame ON (igintion)
ACTION: Check that valves MBN35AA001 and MBH41AA010 are in 'OPEN' position during gas operation and 'CLOSED' during liquid or dual operation. Check position of MBN32AA002 and MBN32005. Check lmit swiches. Check pilot solenoid valves for these valves
MBH33CT001:
KKS: MBH33CT001
TEXT: COOL-AIR TEMP ROT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Rotor cooling air temperature is higher than 330deg C
ACTION: Check that both rotor air coolers are running. Check cleanliness of rotor air cooler

KKS: MBH33CT001
TEXT: COOL-AIR ROT UNLOAD
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Rotor cooling air temperature is higher than 350deg C
ACTION: Check that both rotor air coolers are running. Check cleanliness of rotor air cooler
MBK70EA801:
KKS: MBK70EA801
TEXT: ROTOR TURNING
STATUS: FAIL
REASON: Stroke cylinder has not moved rotor within 60seconds
ACTION: Check the function of solenoid valve MBX51AA001. Check pressure after solenoid valve ( should be in accordance with Final Settings)
MBK70EA802:
KKS: MBK70EA802
TEXT: ROTOR TURNING
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: The breaker module/MCC for one of the rotor barring pumps is not in service position. Over-current protection for one of the rotor barring pumps has been actuated. Level in hp power oil tank is low. Differential pressure across filter is high. Hp power oil pressure is below 30bar with either main or emergency pump in service for more than 5 seconds
ACTION: Put module MCC in service position. Investigate reason for over-current protection actuation and reset. Refill rotor barring oil tank with oil. Clean or replace filter element. Investigate cause of low pressure (see Final Settings for nominal pressure)
MBK70EA804:
KKS: MBK70EA804
TEXT: ROTOR TURNING
STATUS: N. AUTO
REASON: Rotor barring has been switched off after TAT has dropped below 60deg C. Key selector switch at local control box (located above hp oil tank) is not set to 'AUTO' position
ACTION: Switch key selector switch back to AUTO position
MBK70EA805:
KKS: MBK70EA805
TEXT: HP-POW-O RES PUMP
STATUS: IN OP
REASON: Rotor barring reserve pump (dc driven) in operation
ACTION: Investigate reason for rotor barring main pump (ac driven) failure. After rectifying fault switch back from reserve to main pump (refer to operating instructions for procedure)
MBK90CY001:
KKS: MBK90CY001
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN NDE2 VERT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at bearing NDE2, in vertical plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify reading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBK90CY002:
KKS: MBK90CY002
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN NDE2 HORIZ
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at bearing NDE2, in horizontal plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify readnig by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBL30AT001:
KKS: MBL30AT001
TEXT: PULSE FILTER-POWER SUPPLY
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Power supply to filter pulse cleaning control system has failed
ACTION: Check supply fuses at BFA07G01. Determine cause of failure and rectify. Replace fuses as required
MBL30CP002:
KKS: MBL30CP002
TEXT: DP AIR INT FILTER
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Differential pressure over air intake filters is higher than 150mmWg
ACTION: Check cleanliness of filters. Verify justification of alarm with local idicator MBL30CP001. Check that pulse cleaning system is in operation
MBL30CP003:
KKS: MBL30CP003
TEXT: DP AIR INT FILTER
STATUS: > H.HIGH
REASON: Differential pressure over air intake filters is higher than 190mmWg
ACTION: Check cleanliness of filters. Verify justification of alarm with local idicator MBL30CP001. Check that pulse cleaning system is in operation
MBL30CP011:
KKS: MBL30CP011
TEXT: VACUUM AIR INTAKE CH1
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Vacuum in air inlet duct is greater than 30 mbar
ACTION: Check air inlet filters for cleanliness. If air inlet filter are clean recheck setting of pressure switch
MBL30CP011R:
KKS: MBL30CP011R
TEXT: VACUUM AIR INTAKE CH2
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Vacuum in air inlet duct is greater than 30 mbar
ACTION: Check air inlet filters for cleanliness. If air inlet filter are clean recheck setting of pressure switch
MBL30CP020:
KKS: MBL30CP020
TEXT: PULSE COMPR PRESSURE
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Pressure available for filter pulse cleaning is less than 4.1 bar
ACTION: Check that compressor is available. Check position of hand valves in the system. Check for leakages in supply, distribution and manifold piping systems
MBL30EG003:
KKS: MBL30EG003
TEXT: IMPLOSION DOORS
STATUS: OPEN
REASON: One or more of the implosion doors are open
ACTION: Check at filterhouse if implosion doors are closed. If doors are closed check, during next standstill, the limit switches of all doors. Caution: Before leaving the filterhouse, make sure no foreign materials are left. Check filters at filterhouse for cleanliness. Check and record filter differential pressure
MBM31EA800:
KKS: MBM31EA800
TEXT: F LIQ CONTR VALVE POS
STATUS: WRONG
REASON: Fuel oil control valve MBN32AA007 is not open to allow cooling air flow to nozzle
ACTION: Check permissive feed back signals from the fuel valves. Check output signal from control systems. Check behavior an calibration of ehc and servo motor
MBN31CP001:
KKS: MBN31CP001
TEXT: FUEL LIQ FUEL MEAS
STATUS: DISTURB
REASON: Transmitter or module for fuel liquid flow measurement is disturbed
ACTION: Check the fuse on the module, check the transmitter
MBN31CP002:
KKS: MBN31CP002
TEXT: DP FUEL-LIQ FILTER
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Differential pressure over fuel oil filter is higher than 0.8 bar
ACTION: Change over to the stand-by fuel oil filter and clean the dirty one
MBN32AA007:
KKS: MBN32AA007
TEXT: POS CONTR. F LIQ
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Disturbance of position controller LT5410
ACTION: Reset the controller with the push-button on the front plate
MBN35CL003:
KKS: MBN35CL003
TEXT: FUEL-LIQ LEVEL
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Level in fuel oil leakage tank high
ACTION: Check that breaker module of fuel oil leakage pump is in service position. Check that hand isolating valve after the fuel oil block is open. Verify operation of fuel oil leakage pump locally at the fuel oil block. If problem cannot be solved within a short time, the unit must be either shut down immediately or changed over to gas operation
MBP31AA007:
KKS: MBP31AA007
TEXT: POS CONTR F GAS
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Disturbance of position controller LT5410
ACTION: Reset the controller with the push-button on the front plate
MBP31CL010:
KKS: MBP31CL010
TEXT: LIQ. LEVEL - GAS SEPARATOR
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Fluid in gas separator / filter, dirty side, is too high
ACTION: Shut down unit or operate on fuel oil. Isolate gas supply. Drain fluid from lower chamber. Note: Ensure drain valves are closed before recommencing gas operation
MBP31CL011:
KKS: MBP31CL011
TEXT: LIQ. LEVEL - GAS SEPARATOR
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Fluid in gas separator / filter, dirty side, is too high
ACTION: Shut down unit or operate on fuel oil. Isolate gas supply. Drain fluid from lower chamber. Note: Ensure drain valves are closed before recommencing gas operation
MBP31CP014:
KKS: MBP31CP014
TEXT: DP GAS SEPARATOR
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Differential pressure across separator / filter is higher than 0.8 bar
ACTION: Shut down unit or operate on fuel oil. Isolate gas supply. Open separator and clean or replace filter catridges. Note: Separator should be purged with nitrogen prior to opening
MBQ30CP002:
KKS: MBQ30CP002
TEXT: PROP-GAS PRESSURE
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Pressure of propane gas less than 1.3 bar
ACTION: Check that at propane bottle isolating valves are open. Check that propane pressure regulators are correctly adjusted. Replace empty propane gas bottle(s). Check for leakage at pipe connections
MBV10CL001:
KKS: MBV10CL001
TEXT: LUBE-OIL LEVEL
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Level of lube oil less than minimum
ACTION: Check oil system for oil leaks. Refill oil tank with turbine oil

KKS: MBV10CL001
TEXT: LUBE-OIL LEVEL
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Level of lube oil higher than maximum
ACTION: Drain lube oil until a normal oil level has been established
MBV21CP002:
KKS: MBV21CP002
TEXT: DP LUBE-OIL FILTER
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Differential pressure across lube oil filter higher than 0.6 bar
ACTION: Change over to stand-by lube oil filter and clean the dirty filter
MBV21EA801:
KKS: MBV21EA801
TEXT: LUBE-OIL TEMPERATURE
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Lube oil temperature in lube oil tank after filter is less than 18deg C (the later supervision is only active 600 seconds after n > 2700rpm)
ACTION: Check that lube oil storage tank heaters are in service. Check breaker modules of oil storage tank heaters MBV10AH001/002 for disturbances (i.e. overload protection). Check settings/operation of thermostats MBV10CT001/002. Check settings of temperature switches MBV10CT010 and MBV40CT002
MBV21EA802:
KKS: MBV21EA802
TEXT: LUBE OIL VAPOUR FAN
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Vapour fan No.1 not in service with lube oil pressure higher than 0.9 bar or emergency cooling pump in service (or) Vapour fan No 2 not in service with above conditions plus n > 700rpm
ACTION: Check that breaker modules of lube oil vapour fans are in service position. Check breaker modules of lube oil vapour fans for disturbances. If found, investigate reason for MCB tripping and rectify problem
MBV21EA803:
KKS: MBV21EA803
TEXT: EMERG COOL OIL PUMP
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Contactor K10 in panel +BUA02B is not energized within 1 second of receiving an automatic 'ON' order for emergency cooling oil pump
ACTION: Check if relay K10 in panel +BUA02B is activated. If not, check with voltmeter at terminals X10 11/13 if signal is available. Check if contact 22/ 21 of relay K10 is closed. If yes, check if signal is present on P14 bus. If not check wiring of circuit for continuity
MBV21EA804:
KKS: MBV21EA804
TEXT: EMERG COOL OIL PUMP
STATUS: ON
REASON: Emergency cooling pump is in service
ACTION: Note : Indication only. Observe accompanying messages for reason as to why pump is required
MBV22AP001:
KKS: MBV22AP001
TEXT: EMERG COOL OIL PUMP
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: 220 Vdc supply voltage for emergency cooling oil pump is disturbed
ACTION: Check if MCB Q1 in panel +BUA02B is closed. If necessary, investigate reason for MCB tripping and reset. Check incoming 220Vdc voltage is not available, check batteries and battery charger

KKS: MBV22AP001
TEXT: EMERG COOL OIL PUMP
STATUS: OVERL
REASON: Thermal protection for motor activated. Current consumption of emergency cooling oil pump motor too high
ACTION: Check pressure after cooling oil pump. Check/measure current consumption
MBV40CT002:
KKS: MBV40CT002
TEXT: LUBE-OIL TEMPERATURE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Temperature of lube oil after lube oil filter hihgher than 65deg C(MBV40CT002)
ACTION: Check that all lube oil cooling fans are in operation. If not, clear rason for malfunctioning. Check that by-pass valves are in correct position. Check lube oil coolers are clean. If necessary clean coolers. Check setting of lube  oil temperature switch MBV40CT002. Verify that Amot valve is passing oil to coolers
MBV70CL001:
KKS: MBV70CL001
TEXT: LEVEL REL LUBE OIL
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Level in lube oil tank MBV70BB001 is too high
ACTION: Check that power oil and lube oil filter drains and vents are closed. Check that pressuer switch MBV50CP012 drain is closed. Pump out tank with hand pump
MBX00EW201:
KKS: MBX00EW201
TEXT: TURB TRIP MANUAL
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Emergency push-button on either local or remote operators console has been actuated
ACTION:

KKS: MBX00EW201
TEXT: BRG VIBRAT VERT TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Collective trip signal. One or more vibration pickups in vertical plane registers higher than 15mm/s
ACTION: Refer to accompanying trip and alarm messages. Contact ABB

KKS: MBX00EW201
TEXT: BRG VIBRAT HORIZ
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Collective trip signal. One or more vibration pickups in horizontal plane registers higher than 15mm/s
ACTION: Refer to accompanying trip and alarm messages. Contact ABB

KKS: MBX00EW201
TEXT: FIRE PROTECTION
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Emergency fire protection push button on either local or remote operators console or in unit enclosure has been activated
ACTION: Reset with key-switch in unit enclosure, if applicable. Reset fire protection trip
MBX00EW202:
KKS: MBX00EW202
TEXT: 2V3 OVERSPEED 110% TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Two of three over-speed channels have activated
ACTION: Determine reason for over-speed
MBX00EW203:
KKS: MBX00EW203
TEXT: FLAME MONIT CH DIFF
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: 1 out of 3 Fireyes does not detect flame
ACTION: Check that all shutters to flame monitors are open. Remove the corresponding flame detectors and check its function by using a flash light. Check cleanliness of flame detector sight glass

KKS: MBX00EW203
TEXT: FLAME OFF TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: 2 out of 3 fireyes do not detect flame
ACTION: Check that all shutters to flame monitors are open. Remove the corresponding flame detectors and check its function by using a flash light. Check cleanliness of flame detector sight glasses. Check fuel sytems for any irregularities
MBX00EW850:
KKS: MBX00EW850
TEXT: SV TO EMG OIL WIRE
STATUS: BROKE
REASON: Wiring for either solenoid valve MBX62AA010(ch1) or MBX41AA030(ch2) is faulty
ACTION: Check continuity of wiring for both solenoid valves
MBX01EW201:
KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: ACCELERATION
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Acceleration supervision first stage actuated(during start-up)
ACTION: Check if positioning controller LT5410 is reset (red LED on front panel must be illuminated). If necessary reset LT5410 with push-button on ftont panel, but ONLY AFTER SHUT-DWON! Check the two plugs at the electro-hydraulic converter, located in oil regulating panel, are fitted and secure. Check internal fuse in LT5410. If necessary, investigate reason for disturbance and replace fuse

KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: T TURB INL > MAX TRIP CH1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Turbine inlet temperature is higher than 1130deg C(channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: If trip occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves ( for values refer to Final Settings) Check measurement/calibaration of exhaust gas temperature and pressure, compressor discharge pressure and ambient pressure

KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: T TURB INL > HIGH UNLOAD
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Turbine inlet temperature is higher than 1120deg C
ACTION: Reduce set point of TIT controller. Check that are no fast pressure changes in the fuel supply systems. If deloading occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves (for values refer to Final Settings). Check measurement/calibration of exhaust gas temperature and pressure, compressor discharge pressure and ambient pressure

KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: T EXH GAS > MAX TRIP CH 1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Exhaust gas temperature is higher than 575deg C(channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: If trip occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves ( for values refer to Final Settings) Check measurement/calibaration of exhaust gas temperature and pressure, compressor discharge pressure and ambient pressure

KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: T EXH GAS > HIGH UNLOAD
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Exhaust gas temperature is higher than 565deg C
ACTION: Reduce set point of TIT controller. Check that are no fast pressure changes in the fuel supply systems. If deloading occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves (for values refer to Final Settings). Check measurement/calibrat

KKS: MBX01EW201
TEXT: DP/PK2 SHAFT COOL
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Supervision of rotor cooling air flow
ACTION: Check all instrument lines for leakage. Check calibration of transmitter MBH33CP008. Contact ABB
MBX01EW210:
KKS: MBX01EW210
TEXT: BLD-VV NOT OPN TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: One or more of stage 1 pr stage 2 bleed valves is not open with GT speed lower than 2670rpm plus 20seconds or stage 3 bleed valve is not open with GT speed lower than 2790rpm plus 25seconds
ACTION: Ensure that temporary air supply from compressor wash trolly has been disconnected after washing of the of the compressor, especially the adpator piece for the air hosel. If signal persists after run-down, open manhole in bleed valve silencer. Check function of limit switches and check continuity of wiring

KKS: MBX01EW210
TEXT: P-CTR OIL > MAX TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Pressure in control oil system during strat-up is higher than 7.0 bar(Supervision disarms at n > 2700rpm)
ACTION: Check settings of pressure switch MBX43CP001 (oil operation) or MBX45CP001 (gas operation). Values can be found in the Final Settings report. Check adjustment of relevant fuel control valve (refer to final setting report for characteristics)

KKS: MBX01EW210
TEXT: ACCELERATION < MIN TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Acceleration supervision sedcond stage actuated(during start-up)
ACTION: Check if positioning controller LT5410 is reset (red LED on front panel must be illuminated). If necessary reset LT5410 with push-button on ftont panel. Check that the two plugs at the electro-hydraulic converter, located in oil regulating panel, are fitted and secure. Check internal fuse in LT5410. If necessary, investigate reason for disturbance and replace fuse
MBX01EW211:
KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: P-LIQ < MIN TRIP CH1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Fuel oil pressure after fuel oil pump is less than 55 bar with fuel liquid release valve,MBN32AA002, not closed for 2 seconds(channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: Check that all fuel system valves are in correct position.Check function of fuel oil pump. If necessary, investigates reason for MCB tripping and reset. Check fuel forwarding is in service if alarm combined wih alarm MBY00EA802. If unit is operating on gas, check position and lmit switches of fuel oil release valve MBN32AA002

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: HYD TURB PROT CH1(control ch1, not hydraulic)
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Emergency stop push-button MBX62AA001 in oil regulating panel has been actuated (or) Over-speed trip device (112%) has been released (or) P.V. MBX62AA010,MBX41AA030 or MBX41AA031+AA032 has activated (or) Emergency oil pressure has fallen and allowed MBX41AA010 to release (or) Central power oil pressure is less than 25bar
ACTION: Investigates reason for emergency stop push-button actuation and solve problem. Check setting of over-speed trip device(for procedure refer to operating instructions). Investigate reason for P.V. actuation. Investigate reason for failing pressure, e.g. leakage(internal or external)

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: P-GAS < MIN TRIP CH1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Gas pressure before gas control valve is less than 19.0 bar with gas trip valve MBP31AA003 not closed for 2 seconds (channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: Check ARCO atation status. Check positions of all valves in fuel gas system are correct if alarm is combined with MBY00EA804. Check cleanliness of strainer MBP31AT001 if alarm is not combined with alarm MBY00EA804. Check calibration of pressure switch MBP31CP004 (refer to Final Settings for values). If unit is operating on oil, check position and limit switches of gas trip valve MBP31AA003

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: GT CONTROLLER TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Internal supervision of modules used for GT controlling has been activated
ACTION: Refer to P14 system description to find out which module is disturbed and rectify. Cocntact ABB

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: P LUBE OIL < MIN UNLOAD
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Lube oil pressure is less than 0.9 abr (MBV40CP002) with GT speed higher than 66rpm
ACTION: Check that oil level in lube oil tank is above alarm level. Check adjustment of constant pressure valve MBV21DP002 (refer to final settings for values). Check calibration of pressure switch MBV40CP002 (refer to Final Settings for values)

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: BRG TEMP > MAX TRIP CH1
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: The measured temperature on both channel 1 circuits of a particular bearing are in excess of their trip limit(see Final Settings for values)
ACTION: Check measuring circuits of corresponding bearing for continuity. Check oil flow to the corresponding bearing (oil flow can be seen through the sight glass in the lube oil return line with exception of the axial bearing). If there is no flow, check orifice in suply line. Check lube oil supply temperature. If temperature is toohigh, check function and cleanliness of lube oil coolers. Contact ABB

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: SPEED MONITOR 1V3
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: One out of three speed transmitter/monitor systems is disturbed
ACTION: Check signaling loops from the speed pick-ups to LCR for continuity. Check that speed pick-ups are functioning. Trouble shoot transmitters and monitors in accordance with O&M manual module descriptions.

KKS: MBX01EW211
TEXT: SPEED MONITOR 2V3 TRIP
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Two out of three speed transmitter / monitor systems is disturbed
ACTION: Check signaling loops from the speed pick-ups to LCR for continuity. Check that speed pick-ups are functioning. Trouble shoot transmitters and monitors in accordance with O&M manual module descriptions.
MBX01EW212:
KKS: MBX01EW212
TEXT: UNLOAD PROTECTION
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: TAT higher than 565deg C, TIThigher than 1120degC, Rotor cool air temperature higher than 350deg C, Lube oil pressure less than 0.9 bar, Boiler protection activated, Note: Unload protection due to lube oil pressure less than 0.9 bar will automatically deload until unit is off grid, followed by a turbine trip. Reset is not possible
ACTION: Check, which signal has caused the unloading protection. Check exhaust gas measurement. Check both compressor discharge pressure transmitters MBA80CP011 and MBA80CP012. Check rotor cooling air coolers are operating. Check pipework for leakage. Check lube oil pressure(oscillating, low value, dirty filters etc.)
MBX01EW214:
KKS: MBX01EW214
TEXT: CHANNEL DIFF MONIT CTRL
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Failure of set-point tracking (or) Controller module damaged. Note: Change-over to back-up controller is blocked
ACTION: Contact ABB

KKS: MBX01EW214
TEXT: BACK UP CONTROLLER
STATUS: DIST
REASON: Back-up controller module is damaged (or) Set-point comparison / supervision activated
ACTION: Change control module, but utilize sam PROM. Checfk calibration of UA377 module. Contact ABB

KKS: MBX01EW214
TEXT: TEMP LIMITER
STATUS: LEADS
REASON: TAT is higher than 555deg C with back-up controller in operation. Note: Back-up controller has no dead band and grid instability reflects or unit
ACTION: Deload unit untill alarm clears

KKS: MBX01EW214
TEXT: MAIN CONTROLLER
STATUS: DIST
REASON: Module supervision of main controller activated
ACTION: Check signals of control module
MBX01EW220a:
KKS: MBX01EW220a
TEXT: GUIDE-BLADE POS CH1
STATUS: WRONG
REASON: Guide-vane (VIGV) in position below 46deg with GT speed above 66rpm
ACTION: Check, visually, position of the VIGV. Check signals of both angle transmitters. MBA82CG001 and CG002 and if necessary recalibrate them
MBX01EW800:
KKS: MBX01EW800
TEXT: TURB PROTECTION
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Trip channel 1 or 2 is activated
ACTION: Refer to accompanying trip message and eliminate cause of trip

KKS: MBX01EW800
TEXT: TURB. PROT. CH1
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: Collective alarm, turbine protection channel 1
ACTION: Check which transmitter is disturbed (for disturbance signals, refer to P14 system decription). Check modules at Decontic K part of any disturbances. Investigates reason for module disturbnace and solve problem. Check if ther is any disturbance signal coming from the generator breaker. If yes, investigate reason for disturbance in accordance with generator breaker wiring diagrams. Check that there is no disturbance signal from generator protection system (GSX) present. Check VIGV position is correct.
MBX01EW801:
KKS: MBX01EW801
TEXT: BRG TEMP TURBINE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing temperature of turbine bearing, measured with thermocouple MBD11CT001 or MBD11CT002, is higher than  115deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check for oil flow in lube oil drain sight glass. If there is no flow, check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW802:
KKS: MBX01EW802
TEXT: BRG TEMP COMPRESSOR
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing temperature of compressor bearing, measured with thermocouple MBD21CT001 or MBD21CT002, is higher than  115deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check for oil flow in lube oil drain sight glass. If there is no flow, check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW803:
KKS: MBX01EW803
TEXT: BRG TEMP GEN DE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing temperature of generator driven end bearing, measured with thermocouple MKD11CT001 or MKD11CT002, is higher than 105deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check for oil flow in lube oil drain sight glass. If there is no flow, check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW804:
KKS: MBX01EW804
TEXT: BRG TEMP GEN NDE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing tempearture of generator non  driven end bearing, measured with thermocouple MKD21CT001 or MKD21CT002,is higher than 95deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check for oil flow in lube oil drain sight glass. If there is no flow, check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW805:
KKS: MBX01EW805
TEXT: TEMP COMP/GEN
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing temperature of thrust bearing measured with thermocouple MBDCT003 / 005 / 023 / 025, is higher than 95deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW806:
KKS: MBX01EW806
TEXT: RADIAL BRG AUX GEAR
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Bearing temperature of auxiliary gearbox (generator non driven end 2), measured with thermocouple MKD31CT001 or MKD31CT002 is higher than 95deg C
ACTION: Check lube oil temperature after lube oil filter if oil temperature is too high, check oil coolers for cleanliness. Check lube oil pressure after oil filter. If necessary, readjust oil pressure with constant pressure valve MBV21DP002. Check for oil flow in lube oil drain sight glass. If there is no flow, check supply line and flow restriction orifice before bearing. Contact ABB
MBX01EW807:
KKS: MBX01EW807
TEXT: T ROT FRONT FACE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Temperature of rotor cooling air, turbine side, is higher than 140deg C with speed higher than 2800rpm for more than 60seconds
ACTION: Check thermocouple and calibration of transmitter. Contact ABB
MBX02EW201:
KKS: MBX02EW201
TEXT: T EXH GAS > MAX TRIP CH2
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Exhaust gas temperature is higher than 575deg C(channel 2 actuation)
ACTION: If trip occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves (for values refer to Final Settings). Check measurement of exhaust gas temperature.

KKS: MBX02EW201
TEXT: T TURB INL > MAX TRIP CH2
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Turbine inlet temperature is higher than 1130deg C(channel 2 actuation)
ACTION: If trip occurred during fuel change over, check adjustment of fuel control valves (for values refer to Final Settings). Check measurement / calibration of exhaust gas temperature and pressure, compressor discharge pressure and ambient pressure
MBX02EW211R:
KKS: MBX02EW211R
TEXT: HYD TURB PROT CH2(control ch2, not hydraulic)
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Emergency stop push-button MBX62AA001 in oil regulating panel has been actuated (or) Over-speed trip device (112%) has been released (or) P.V. MBX62AA010,MBX41AA030 or MBX41AA031+AA032 has activated (or) Emergency oil pressure has fallen and allowed MBX41AA010 to release (or) Central power oil pressure is less than 25 bar
ACTION: Investigate reason for emergency stop push-button actuation and solve problem. Check settings of over-speed trip devices (for procedure refer to operating instructions). Investigate reason for p.v. actuation. Investigate reason for failing pressure, e.g. leakage (internal or external)

KKS: MBX02EW211R
TEXT: BRG TEMP > MAX TRIP CH2
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: The measured temperature on both channel 2 circuits of a particular bearing are in excess of their trip limit(see Final Settings for values)
ACTION: Check measuring circuits of corresponding bearing for continuity. Check oil flow to the corresponding bearing (oil flow can be seen through the sight glass in the lube oil return line with exception of the axial bearing). If there is no flow, check orifice in supply line. Check lube oil supply temperature. If temperature is too high, check function and cleanliness of lube oil coolers. Contact ABB

KKS: MBX02EW211R
TEXT: P-GAS < MIN TRIP CH2
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Gas pressure before gas control valve is less than 19.0 bar with gas trip valve MBP31AA003 not closed for 2 seconds (channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: Check ARCO atation status. Check positions of all valves in fuel gas system are correct if alarm is combined with MBY00EA804. Check cleanliness of strainer MBP31AT001 if alarm is not combined with alarm MBY00EA804. Check calibration of pressure switch MBP31CP004 (refer to Final Settings for values). If unit is operating on oil, check position and limit switches of gas trip valve MBP31AA003

KKS: MBX02EW211R
TEXT: P-LIQ < MIN TRIP CH2
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Fuel oil pressure after fuel oil pump is less than 55 bar with fuel liquid release valve,MBN32AA002, not closed for 2 seconds(channel 1 actuation)
ACTION: Check that all fuel system valves are in correct position.Check function of fuel oil pump. If necessary, investigates reason for MCB tripping and reset. Check fuel forwarding is in service if alarm combined wih alarm MBY00EA802. If unit is operating on gas, check position and lmit switches of fuel oil release valve MBN32AA002
MBX02EW220R:
KKS: MBX02EW220R
TEXT: GUIDE-BLADE POS CH2
STATUS: WRONG
REASON: Guide-vane (VIGV) in position below 46deg with GT speed above 66rpm
ACTION: Check, visually, position of the VIGV. Check signals of both angle transmitters. MBA82CG001 and CG002 and if necessary recalibrate them
MBX02EW800R:
KKS: MBX02EW800R
TEXT: TURB PROTECT CH2
STATUS: FAILR
REASON: Collective alarm, turbine protection channel 2
ACTION: Check which transmitter is disturbed (for disturbance signals, refer to P14 system decription). Check VIGV position is correct
MBX10EA801:
KKS: MBX10EA801
TEXT: PROTECT CHANNEL 1/2
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Selected test sequence has failed to release pressure within channel under test(trip)
ACTION: Conduct full set of hydraulic tests on both channels, to determine common element involved in failed tests.(Use F.G. diagrams for assistance). Shut down unit and rectify defect
MBX10EA802:
KKS: MBX10EA802
TEXT: HYD TRIP VLV POS
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: One of the test sides is in position TEST for longer than 4 minutes
ACTION: Check that all test sequences are OFF. Check function of PV test side MBX41AA002A/B. Shut-down unit and check PV MBX41AA002A/B for defect
MBX10EA803:
KKS: MBX10EA803
TEXT: RESET OVER-SPEED
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Over-speed reset pressure is higher than 0.8 bar for longer than 4 seconds with emergency oil pressure established
ACTION: Check pressure in system MBX63 with independent pressure gauge. Recalibrate switch if required. Check that electrical supply to solenoid valve MBX63AA001 is off(solenoid should be at ambient temperature). Check valve for leakage or blockage of the drain
MBX10EA880:
KKS: MBX10EA880
TEXT: FG TURB PROT TEST
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Group alarm. Either: Speed during live over-speed test has exceeded 3420rpm (or) Tolerance time during protection test sequence has been exceeded (or) Alarm MBX01EA801
ACTION: Ensure speed is reduced imediately to 3000rpm (automatic command). Shut down the unit. Check that emergency oil line to over-speed trip device is not blocked. Contact ABB. Using POS display and FG Test Channel diagrams investigate in which step and for what reason sequence has failed. See alarm MBX01EA801
MBX21EA801:
KKS: MBX21EA801
TEXT: POWER OIL SUPPLY
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Power oil pressure is not higher than 35 bar within 10 seconds of F.G. ON order
ACTION: Check system, in particular ensuring that filter ventilation and drainage valves are closed. Check pressure by measurement. Check pressure regulator MBX21DP001 if pressure incorrect. Check pressure switch if measured pressure is correct
MBX21CP002:
KKS: MBX21CP002
TEXT: DP LP-POW-OIL FILTER
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Power oil filter differential is higher than 1.2 bar
ACTION: Change-over to stand-by power oil filter and clean the dirty filter
MBY00EA801:
KKS: MBY00EA801
TEXT: FUEL-LIQ VALVES
STATUS: N.CLOSED
REASON: One or more of the fuel liquid valves are not in closed position during gas opeartion or standstill(Exception: MBN32AA007 is held partially open during gas operation for cooling)
ACTION: Check by using the C&I daigrams, which valve is not clesed (C&I,Section 16: FG Fuel selection). Check, locally, position of faulty valve and investigate reason why valve did not close. If valve is in closed position, check limit switches of corresponding valve.
MBY00EA802:
KKS: MBY00EA802
TEXT: P BEF FUEL OIL PUMP
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Fuel suply pressure before fuel oil pump is less than 7 bar with booster pump ON
ACTION: Check that forwarding pump(s) are running. Check that all system hand valves are correctly positioned
MBY00EA804:
KKS: MBY00EA804
TEXT: P BEF GAS MAIN STOP VLV
STATUS: < MIN
REASON: Gas supply pressure before gas main stop valve, MBP31AA001, is less than x bar with valve open. Note: With unit on line this signal will automatically initiate a fuel change-over to diesel. X=23bar for GT-11 GT-21 and x=22bar for GT-12 GT-22 and x=21bar for GT-13 GT-23
ACTION: Check that hand valve MBP31AA010 is fully open. Verify with ARCO that the gas reducing station is in normal operating condition. Check settings of gas reducing station (refer to O&M manuals & final setting)
MBY00EA805:
KKS: MBY00EA805
TEXT: FUEL-GAS VALVES
STATUS: N.CLOSED
REASON: One or more of the fuel gas valves are not in shut-down position during oil operation or standstill within 60seconds of order for gas main stop valve to close
ACTION: Check by using the C&I digrams, which valve is not closed (C&I, Section 16:FG Fuel Selection). Check, locally, position of faulty valve and investigate reason why valve did not close. If valve is in closed position, check limit switches of corresponding valve
MBY00EA806:
KKS: MBY00EA806
TEXT: GAS RELIEF VACUUM
STATUS: < LOW
REASON: Vacuum in gas control cabinet is less than 2mbar with gas main stop valve MBP31AA001 open
ACTION: Check that all doors of gas control cabinet are closed and secure. Verify that gas relief fan MBP33AN001 is in opearartion.
MBY00EA807:
KKS: MBY00EA807
TEXT: FUEL-LIQUID DRAIN VALV
STATUS: N.CLOSED
REASON: Combustion chamber liquid drain valve not closed, with central power oil established for more than 10 seconds
ACTION: Check power oil supply. Check function of valve. Check position of limit switch
MBY10DA802:
KKS: MBY10DA802
TEXT: ACT POWER MEASUREMENT
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Channel difference between channels 1 and 2 of compressor delivery pressure is higher than 3% for more than 2 seconds
ACTION: Check both incoming power signals and locate fault
MBY10DA805:
KKS: MBY10DA805
TEXT: GT-CONTROLLER
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: GT simulator switched on (or) Either both positioning controller(s) are not reset (or) Speed measuring disturbed (or) Active power measurement fault (or) Compressor discharge pressure measuring fault (or) Exhaust gas temperature measurement fault
ACTION: Switch off GT simulator. Reset positioning controller(s), LT5410 (red lamp on front panel must be illuminated). Check speed measuring circuits (refer also to electrical wiring diagrams). Check active power signal to correctness. Check the signals from both exhaust gas temperature transmitters
MBY10DS502:
KKS: MBY10DS502
TEXT: SPEED WINDOW CH DIFF
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Channel difference between channel 1 and channel 2 of speed measuring
ACTION: Check signalling loops from the speed pick-ups to LCR for continuity. Check that speed pick-ups are functioning. Trouble shoot transmitters and monitors in accordance with O&M manual module descriptions
MBY10DT502:
KKS: MBY10DT502
TEXT: EXH-GAS TEMP MEASUREMENT
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Channel difference between channels 1 and 2 of exhaust gas temperature measurement is higher than 1.5%
ACTION: Check both incoming temperature signals/systems and locale fault
MBY10DU500:
KKS: MBY10DU500
TEXT: ACT POWER LIMITATION
STATUS: ACTIVAT
REASON: Active Power limitation of 190 MW reached
ACTION: Investigate for reason how active power could reach the limit
MKA13CL001:
KKS: MKA13CL001
TEXT: LEVEL LEAK GEN
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Generator water leakage detector(s) has activated
ACTION: Deload and shut down unit immediately. Earth generator and enter base frame through inspection hatches to ascertain source of leakage. Rectify and normalize system. Remove water from detector pits and ensure drain valve is re-closed
MKC10DE000:
KKS: MKC10DE000
TEXT: VOLTAGE REGULATOR
STATUS: MAN
REASON: Voltage regulator in manual channel operating mode; either manually selected or due to automatic change-over from automatic channel
ACTION: If change-over was automatic investigate fault of automatic channel (refer to local excitation indication panel). If fault cleared the excitation can be changed back to automatic channel
MKC10DE010:
KKS: MKC10DE010
TEXT: LOAD ANGLE LIMITER
STATUS: IN OP
REASON: Load angle limiter in operation
ACTION: Raise the reference value (set-point) for generator voltage until limiter is out of operation

KKS: MKC10DE010
TEXT: ROTOR CURRENT LIMITER
STATUS: IN OP
REASON: Rotor current limiter in operation
ACTION: Lower the reference value (set-point) for generator voltage until limiter is out of operation

KKS: MKC10DE010
TEXT: STATOR CURRENT LIMITER
STATUS: IN OP
REASON: Stator current limiter in operation
ACTION: Inductive stator current limiter in operation: lower the reference value(set-point) for generator voltage until limiter is out of operation. Capacitive stator current limiter in operation: raise the reference value (set point) for generator voltage until limiter is out of operation
MKC10EG011:
KKS: MKC10EG011
TEXT: EXCIT EQUIPMENT
STATUS: WARN
REASON: Common warning announcement from the excitation system
ACTION: Identify the reason fpr the alarm (refer to electrical diagrams). After solving the problems, reset alarm at the local excitation alarm panel
MKC10EG012:
KKS: MKC10EG012
TEXT: EXCIT EQUIPMENT
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Common fault announcement from the excitation system
ACTION: Identify reason for the trip of the excitation system (refer to excitation system local alarm panel as well as the electrical diagrams) and solve the problem
MKD10CY020:
KKS: MKD10CY020
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN DE VERT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at generator driven side bearing, in vertical plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify rading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MKD10CY021:
KKS: MKD10CY021
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN DE HORIZ
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at generator driven side bearing, in horizontal plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify rading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MKD20CY020:
KKS: MKD20CY020
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN NDE VERT
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at generator non driven side bearing, in vertical plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify rading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MBY20CY021:
KKS: MBY20CY021
TEXT: VIBR BRG GEN NDE HORIZ
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Vibrations at generator non driven side bearing, in horizontal plane, are higher than 8 mm/s
ACTION: Verify rading by cross check/calibration. Contact ABB
MKY01EA111:
KKS: MKY01EA111
TEXT: SEL MODULE GRID CB
STATUS: MAN
REASON: Synchronizing selection key for grid breaker is set to MANUAL position
ACTION: If manual synchronization is not intended, put key selector switch back to AUTO position
MKY01EG801:
KKS: MKY01EG801
TEXT: CHAN MONIT 1 MAN OPE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: First channel of manual synchronizing supervision for grid circuit breaker closing actuated
ACTION: Contact ABB
MKY01EG802:
KKS: MKY01EG802
TEXT: CONTACT MONIT SYN GCB
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Channel supervision for synchronizing of grid circuit breaker out of service or disturbed
ACTION: Contact ABB
MKY01EG803:
KKS: MKY01EG803
TEXT: SYN GRID CIRC BREAKER
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: The 3 minute time frame for synchronizing of grid circuit breaker has expired(first channel)
ACTION: Restart synchronizing sequence. Check green indication lamp on top of operator's local panel for close order from synchronizing panel. If lamp illuminates, but grid circuit breaker does not close, check wiring ON order of grid circuit breaker
MKY01EG804:
KKS: MKY01EG804
TEXT: GEN VOLT-GRID VOLT
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Difference between grid and general voltage is too high (first channel)
ACTION: Check both voltages on double voltage meter, localted on operator's local panel, and determine if fault is with excitation system or the grid. If necessary, shut down and adjust voltage with off-line tap changer of main transformer
MKY01GS101:
KKS: MKY01GS101
TEXT: CHAN MONIT 2 MAN OPE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Second channel of manual synchronizing supervision for grid circuit breaker closing actuated
ACTION: Contact ABB

KKS: MKY01GS101
TEXT: GRID CIRC BREAK AUX VO
STATUS: TRIPD
REASON: Control voltage for grid breaker disturbed
ACTION: Check control of grid breaker in the GIS building
MKY01EA111:
KKS: MKY01EA111
TEXT: SEL MODULE GEN CB
STATUS: MAN
REASON: Synchronizing selection key for generator breaker is set to MANUAL position
ACTION: If manual synchronization is not intended, put key selector switch back to AUTO position
MKY02EG801:
KKS: MKY02EG801
TEXT: CHAN MONIT 1 MAN OPE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: First channel of manual synchronizing supervision for generator circuit breaker closing actuated
ACTION: Contact ABB
MKY02EG802:
KKS: MKY02EG802
TEXT: CONT MONIT SYNC GEN CB
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Channel supervision for synchronizing of generator circuit breaker out of service or disturbed
ACTION: Contact ABB
MKY02EG803:
KKS: MKY02EG803
TEXT: SYN GEN CIRC BREAK
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: The 3 minute time frame for synchronizing of generator circuit breaker has expired(first channel)
ACTION: Restart synchronizing sequence. Check green indication lamp on top of operator's local panel for close order from synchronizing panel. If lamp illuminates, but generator circuit breaker does not close, check wiring ON order of generator circuit breaker
MKY02EG804:
KKS: MKY02EG804
TEXT: GEN VOLT-GRID VOLT
STATUS: > MAX
REASON: Difference between grid and generator voltage is too high (second channel)
ACTION: Check both voltages on double voltage meter, localted on operator's local panel, and determine if fault is with excitation system or the grid. If necessary, shut down and adjust voltage with off-line tap changer of main transformer
MKY02GS101:
KKS: MKY02GS101
TEXT: CHAN MONIT 2 MAN OPE
STATUS: ACTIV
REASON: Second channel of manual synchronizing supervision for generator circuit breaker closing actuated
ACTION: Contact ABB

KKS: MKY02GS101
TEXT: GEN CIRC BREAK AUX VO
STATUS: TRIPD
REASON: Control voltages for ON/OFF circuits generator breaker disturbed. Supply 220Vdc incoming to CTA01 failure. Supply 24 Vdc incoming to CTA01 failure
ACTION: Check at the generator breaker module +CTA01 the following fuse breakers: Q401, Q402, Q511, Q512(refer to electrical diagrams)
PCB70CT002:
KKS: PCB70CT002
TEXT: COOLING WATER TEMPERATURE
STATUS: > HIGH
REASON: Temperature of generator cooling water, after pumps, is higher than 65deg C
ACTION: Check that all cooling fans are in service. If necessary investigate reason for MCB tripping and reset. Check cleanliness of coolers and, if necessary, clean coolers
SAB10AN010:
KKS: SAB10AN010
TEXT: AIR CONDITION
STATUS: FAULT
REASON: Common alarm indication from air conditioning unit for local control alarm
ACTION: Check local indications on air conditioning to locale the disturbance and solve problem in accordance with air conditioning maintanance instructions
UMB00GW001:
KKS: UMB00GW001
TEXT: PROXIMITY SENSOR
STATUS: DIST
REASON: One or more of the gas cubicle proximity sensors(Namurs) is in disturbance
ACTION: Check isolation amplifiers in marshaling cubicle UMB00 to determine defect element. Replace as required
